shows.title: Anecdotal Evidence: Reading and Q&A
shows.desc:
A true contender for Britain’s best loved poet, Wendy Cope (Making Cocoa for Kingsley Amis, Two Cures for Love) has succinctly skewered ‘Bloody Men’, lamented with women priests and is described by the Times as “funny, melancholy and devastatingly observant”.

Wendy Cope OBE is a former primary school teacher, a freelance writer and Faber poet with five published collections.

Wendy will read from her work before being joined by Martin Wroe for interview and Q&A.
